flawed_nl_solution:
Three years from now, Kate will be 29 years + 3 years = <<29+3=37>>37 years old.
So by that time, Tully will be 37 years x 2 = <<37*2=74>>74 years old.
This means, Tully is 74 years - 3 years = <<74-3=71>>71 years old now.
Therefore, Tully was 71 years - 1 year = 70 years old last year.
#### 70

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 37. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
